macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indices Dip Slightly Amid Broadening Market Leadership
items.summary: S&P 500 closed at 6940.01 (-0.06%), Nasdaq Composite at 23515.39 (-0.06%), and DJIA at 49359.33 (-0.17%) on Friday, with VIX steady at 15.86. Small and mid-cap stocks outperformed large caps, signaling broadening bull market participation and high S&P500 earnings breadth.

items.title: Goldman Sachs Surges on Record Trading Revenue; JPMorgan Dips
items.summary: Major US banks reported strong Q4 results driven by trading revenues; Goldman Sachs shares rose 4.6% on record equity trading, while JPMorgan Chase fell 4.2% due to weak investment banking fees despite meeting expectations.

items.title: Hang Seng Advances 2.3% on Healthcare and AI Optimism
items.summary: Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index rose 2.3% to 26,845 last week, led by healthcare gains including Alibaba Health (+17.9%) on AI health assistant success and Alibaba (+13.5%) after AI upgrades. Bullish trend intact with golden cross in moving averages.

items.title: Indian Markets Open Lower Amid Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Nifty 50 opened down 0.16% and Sensex down 0.09% on January 19, reflecting global caution due to geopolitical tensions; prior close saw Nifty down 0.42% and Sensex 0.39%.

items.title: DJIA Trades Flat with Elevated Risk from Macro Data and Earnings
items.summary: Dow Jones hovered near unchanged after intraday swings of 0.5%, as markets digest recent US inflation data, Fed rate cut expectations, and upcoming earnings from Dow components amid heightened volatility risks.

items.title: Saxo Bank Notes Contained Volatility but Downside Skew in Options
items.summary: US markets saw minor declines with S&P 500 at 6,939.95 (-0.1%), Nasdaq -0.1%, Dow -0.2%; Hang Seng fell 0.3% amid China data caution. VIX at 15.86 with skew index at 153.6 indicating tail risk concerns ahead of Davos and earnings.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Crashes with $800M Liquidations as Bitcoin Falls Below $93K
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market dropped 2.8-3% to $3.2T, with Bitcoin trading between $91,910-$95,531 and dipping below $93K due to $763-800M in leveraged long position liquidations triggered by macroeconomic risks, Trump's tariff threats, and Fed uncertainty. Ethereum fell below $3,200, Solana down 6%, amid capital shift to gold amid WW3 fears.

items.title: Bitcoin Network Hashrate Hits Lowest Level Since September 2025
items.summary: Bitcoin's network hashrate dropped to its lowest since September 2025, coinciding with price declines and market-wide downturns affecting major assets like ETH (-3.36%), BNB (-2.17%), and SOL (-6.02%).

items.title: U.S. Senate Circulates Draft Crypto Market Structure Legislation
items.summary: A draft bill in the U.S. Senate proposes clearer regulatory definitions for major crypto assets, signaling progress toward market structure clarity that could boost institutional participation and compliant products.

items.title: Polygon Acquires Firms to Expand into Stablecoin Payments
items.summary: Polygon announced acquisitions of payment and infrastructure firms to focus on stablecoin-based transaction networks, positioning it for regulated enterprise-grade payments and cross-border settlements.

items.title: South Korea Updates Guidelines for Corporate Crypto Investments
items.summary: South Korean regulators introduced rules allowing listed companies and professional investors to allocate capital to select digital assets, aligning with global trends for institutional participation.

items.title: Coinbase Launches Strategic Solana Validator
items.summary: Coinbase began operating a strategic validator on Solana to support network growth and infrastructure amid modest price gains for SOL.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Aibrary Launches World's First AI Learning Companion with Nova Agent
items.summary: Aibrary announced a major platform update on January 19, 2026, introducing Nova, an AI agent with long-term memory and Idea Twin for personalized learning via podcasts, book summaries, and cognitive science-based interactions.

items.title: Pearson Research: AI Productivity Gains Require Paired Skilling, Could Add $6.6T to US Economy by 2034
items.summary: New Pearson report released January 19, 2026, at Davos finds that combining AI with employee skilling could boost US economy by up to $6.6T by 2034, addressing the 'learning gap' hindering current productivity gains.

items.title: USF-Led AI Study Reveals Global Surge in Floating Algae
items.summary: University of South Florida researchers used AI to analyze ocean data, publishing the first global study on floating algae surges on January 19, 2026, highlighting AI's role in processing large environmental datasets.

items.title: AI in Drug Discovery Market Report Forecasts Growth to 2040
items.summary: A new market research report released January 19, 2026, predicts strong growth in AI for drug discovery driven by investments from NVIDIA, Insilico Medicine, Google DeepMind, Pfizer, and Roche to accelerate development.

items.title: Machine Unlearning Emerges as Key for Enterprise AI Privacy by 2026
items.summary: Article discusses machine unlearning, a new science to delete specific data from AI models without retraining, predicted to become standard in enterprise platforms by 2026 for compliance and privacy.

items.title: AI Skills in Job Postings Rise 5% YoY, Context Engineering Key for 2026
items.summary: Manpower Group data from December shows 5% YoY increase in AI skills mentions in jobs, with context engineering, trust-building, and AI sovereignty as top skills needed for 2026 amid growing demand.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: India Approves 2026 Digital Work Plan with ASEAN
items.summary: India and ASEAN approved a comprehensive ICT training and capacity building plan, including the India-ASEAN Regulators’ Conference and telecom ICT solutions deployment. The ASEAN-India Fund was operationalized to finance digital transformation projects in ASEAN states.

items.title: India Post Delivers First ONDC Online Order as Logistics Provider
items.summary: The Department of Posts successfully delivered its first online order via the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC), entering as a Logistics Service Provider on the platform.

items.title: World’s First Global Ice Vault Launched in Antarctica
items.summary: Scientists inaugurated the first global ice vault in Antarctica to preserve mountain ice core samples threatened by glacier melting due to global warming.

items.title: Galgotias University Opens IIT Mandi Catalyst Satellite Centre
items.summary: Galgotias University inaugurated the IIT Mandi Catalyst Satellite Centre at its Greater Noida campus to foster innovation and technology development.

items.title: US Embassy Nepal Launches 'Code for Impact' Nationwide Tech Hackathon
items.summary: The US Embassy in Nepal and Aadyanta Advisory launched a nationwide tech hackathon called 'Code for Impact' to promote technological solutions.
